-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                                 Release Notes
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Director: Taylor Hackford
Writers: Ross Thomas (story), Jimmy Santiago Baca (screenplay),
Stars: Damian Chapa, Jesse Borrego, Benjamin Bratt 



Based on the true life experiences of poet Jimmy Santiago Baca, the film focuses 
on half-brothers Paco and Cruz, and their bi-racial cousin Miklo. It opens in 
1972, as the three are members of an East L.A. gang known as the "Vatos Locos", 
and the story focuses on how a violent crime and the influence of narcotics 
alter their lives. Miklo is incarcerated and sent to San Quentin, where he makes 
a "home" for himself. Cruz becomes an exceptional artist, but a heroin addiction 
overcomes him with tragic results. Paco becomes a cop and an enemy to his 
"carnal", Miklo.
